text: and it is my pleasure to announce today
the Amazon elastic file
system which is a managed service to
easily set up and share and scale your
shared file
storage and so it's a fully managed
system to run with
ec2 it can manage small applications or
really large applications because it
scales to a ped by scale or larger it's
SSD based so it's going to be fast and
have high throughput and low latency and
it's highly available and durable in
significant part too
because the service automatically
replicates your file system to multiple
availability zones kind of like S3 does
so you don't have to worry about that at
all and then your ec2 instances in that
same region regardless what availability
Zone they're in can access that file
system that's been replicated across
those azs in that same region it's
simple it's really fast to be able to
set up and uh and spin up your SK your
file system it is built to integrate
with all your existing apps it supports
nfsv4 and the pricing model is simple
there's no upfront costs there no
commitments you only pay for the storage
that you
consume so it's simple it's elastic it
allows you to dynamically and
automatically resize your file system as
you add more files and similar similarly
it allows you to shrink when you
actually remove files and it effectively
means that you only pay for what you use
it's a simple and elastic and
scalable whether you want to use this
for an application that's
small Dev test or if you want to use it
for something very large that needs very
high demands and requirements for
scalability because you can grow elastic
file system to a pyte scale or more it
handles all of those use cases it not
only scales your storage automatically
it also scales your throughput and your
iops automatically so you don't have to
figure out how much iops you need to
provision and then has low latency
consistent support for thousands of
concurrent NFS connections
the preview will start in the summer
we're really excited to let you get your
hands on it if you're interested in
registering for the preview please go to
the URL there which is aws.amazon.com
slfs we're very excited about this
[Applause]
